title: The Shawshank Redemption
description: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

reviews.quote: The Shawshank Redemption is a movie about time, patience and loyalty -- not sexy qualities, perhaps, but they grow on you during the subterranean progress of this story, which is about how two men serving life sentences in prison become friends and find a way to fight off despair.

Stephen King's 1982 novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption is more like a fable than a horror story. Darabont transforms it into the season's most affecting and satisfying movie -- a story of survival and friendship inside a hellhouse.

title: The Godfather
description: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

reviews.quote: One of the greatest American films of all time, The Godfather gets better with age, as does the Mafia itself.
Coppola's film is rivaled only by Citizen Kane and Casablanca in the pantheon of great American cinema.

title: Inception
description: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.

reviews.quote: Inception does a difficult thing. It is wholly original, cut from new cloth, and yet structured with action movie basics so it feels like it makes more sense than (quite possibly) it does.
DiCaprio gives a tour-de-force performance, but the film is also a triumph of design. Nolan deserves all credit for making the most original movie of a brain-heavy summer season.

title: Interstellar
description: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.

reviews.quote: Interstellar is above all a terrifically entertaining science-fiction movie, quivering with wonder, patriotism, and corn.
Nolan breaks his own rules, but he does it for a reason: to blow our minds. Interstellar aims high and wide, and it scores.

title: Forrest Gump
description: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal, and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

reviews.quote: Forrest Gump is a magical movie. It is a film that restores our faith in humanity.
Forrest Gump is a movie heartbreaker of oddball wit and startling grace.

title: The Matrix
description: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

reviews.quote: The Matrix did not invent all its material, but most of it, and it cleverly elaborated on everything it borrowed, making the film seem original even when it was not.
The Matrix is mind-blowing. It's the most exciting film of the year.

title: Schindler's List
description: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

reviews.quote: Steven Spielberg's Schindler's List is not only a great film, but an important one as well, and it arrives on the DVD format with an impeccable transfer that should make the film's beauty and horror all the more striking.
Spielberg has made the defining Holocaust movie. His film, magnificent and appalling, shows that every image is indelible, yet he finds images of transcendent hope.

title: The Dark Knight
description: When the menace known as The Joker emerges from his mysterious past, he wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham. The Dark Knight must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

reviews.quote: The Dark Knight is not a simplistic tale of good and evil. Batman is good, yes, The Joker is evil, yes. But Batman poses a more complex puzzle than usual: The citizens of Gotham City are in an uproar, calling him a vigilante and blaming him for the deaths of policemen and others.
The Dark Knight isn't just the best Batman movie ever, it's a classic you'll want to see over and over. It's going to haunt you.

title: Fight Club
description: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.

reviews.quote: The best films always seem to inspire the most interesting conversations, and Fight Club is definitely one of those films.
Fight Club is a dazzling tale. A hell of a ride. It's about the most controversial film since Clockwork Orange, and rightly so. Fight Club is a masterpiece.

title: Pulp Fiction
description: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

reviews.quote: Pulp Fiction is a breathtaking triumph of filmmaking. It's a wild, exhilarating ride.
Tarantino's landmark and memorable film Pulp Fiction is a powerful piece of work from the mind of one of the most talented directors working today.
